lines.content: * Represents Duke - an interactive virtual assistant to organize tasks.
* Constructs a Duke object and creates a new Ui object for user interaction
* Introduces Duke and initiates interactive conversation with user
* Creates a new Duke object and begins interaction
* Represents Deadlines which are ListObjects that store deadline (date and time) with the task
* Constructs a Deadline object with given task description and status, with unspecified deadline
* @param status int representing completion status as 1 if finished and 0 otherwise
* Constructs a Deadline object with given task description, status, and deadline
* @param status int representing completion status as 1 if finished and 0 otherwise
* @param doBy String representing deadline (date and time) for task
public Deadline (String task, int status, String doBy) {
* Returns the String representation of the Deadline object
* Reads String representing date and time and returns an alternate String representation of it
* @param txt String representing date and time in the format of yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
* @return String representation of date and time in alternate format of MMM dd yyy HH:mm
* Represents an Event which is a Listobject with a task along with the event date, start and end time
* Constructs an Event object with given task decription and status and unspecified time
* @param status int with value 1 if event is completed and 0 otherwise
* Constructs an Event object with give task description, status and time
* @param status int with value 1 if event is completed and 0 otherwise
* @param eventTime String representing date, start and end times of event
public Event(String task, int status, String eventTime) {
* Returns String representation of Event object
* Reads String representing event time and returns it in alternate format
* @param txt String representing event time (date, start time, end time) in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm HH:mm
* @return String representing event time in format MMM dd yyyy HH:mm HH:mm as date, start and end times
return dateNew + " from: " + timeStart +  " to: " + timeEnd;
* Class to store list items with task and status of completion
* Constructs a ListObject with given task description and status
* @param status int with value 1 if task is complete and 0 otherwise
* @return int with value 1 if task is complete and 0 otherwise
* @return String indicating status of completion of task
* Switches the status of completion of task
* Checks if the task description contains the given keyword
* @param keyword String representing the keyword to check for in task description
* @return boolean true if the description contains the word and false otherwise
* Returns String representation of the ListObject
* Represents ToDo which is a listObject with only a task decription
* Constructs a ToDo object with given task description and status
* @param status int with value 1 if task is complete and 0 otherwise
* Returns String representing the ToDo object
* Represents the Parser of Duke which parses and interprets user commands
* Constructs a ParserDuke object with given command
* Prints response for empty user command
System.out.println("The folly of youth to speak with no words! Speak again, my friend!");
* Reads the user command, initiates completion of the appropriate action and prints response
System.out.println("These are the tasks on your list!");
System.out.println("Very well! One less burden to bear! I have marked this complete:");
System.out.println("And so it must be. We leave behind what we can not hold on to.\nI have removed this from your list:");
System.out.println("The folly of youth to want to do nothing! Write your task following 'todo'");
System.out.println("'Tis a new sky for you to scale! Here! \n" + newItem.toString()
+ "\nYou now have " + listOfItems.knowTaskCount() + " tasks to do!"
System.out.println("Mark this on your calendar! \n" + newItem.toString()
+ "\nYou now have " + listOfItems.knowTaskCount() + " tasks to do!"
System.out.println("The folly of youth to cheat Time! Write your task following 'deadline'");
+ "\nYou now have " + listOfItems.knowTaskCount() + " tasks to do!"
System.out.println("Come Alive! Write an activity following 'event'");
System.out.println("Here is what you are looking for!");
System.out.println("Why trouble me with the unrefined language of the youth! Speak plainly, my friend!");
* Represents Storage class responsible for editing and saving user's task list information in a file and reading from saved file
* Constructs a Storage object which reads from and writes to a file of given file path
* Reads from file with given file path containing saved user tasks, if one exists, or creates such a file
* @return TaskList saved in the file (if it exists) or a new one otherwise
* Updates the file with given path to store the new list of tasks the user wants to save
* @param lst TaskList with a list of tasks the user wishes to save
public static void makeListFile(String path, TaskList lst) {
* Represents TaskList which stores a list of tasks the user wants to store and implements the Serializable interface
* Constructs a TaskList with an empty ArrayList of ListObjects
* Sets the taskslist of the TaskList object to be input list
* @param list ArrayList of ListObjects the user wished to store
* Returns the number of tasks stored
* @return int representing number of tasks stored
* Handles instructions on modifying a specific item in the list
* @param instruction String representing type of action to be performed
* @param itemNum int representing the item number to be modified
public void handleItem(String instruction, int itemNum) {
* Adds a ListObject (task) to the taskslist field
* @param obj ListObject representing the task to be added
* Returns the number of tasks stored
* @return String representing the number of tasks stored
* Returns the taskslist stored in the object
* @return ArrayList representing the list of tasks stored
* Returns the String representation of a TaskList object
* Represents Ui that interacts with the user and facilitates conversation
* Prints Duke's self-introduction and helps to customise its personality.
String intro = "I once wandered these halls, centuries ago. I am Duke Aemon of Old.\n";
String quote1 = "Indeed, my memory is long when I am but a ghost of a memory myself..." +
"\nBut you are young blood. What brings you to these ancient halls?"
* Exits chat if user types "bye" and prints user input otherwise.
System.out.println("Ah! And so we part here today.\n We may yet meet again...Farewell, my friend!");
* Prints a farewell message at the end of the conversation
System.out.println("Ah! And so we part here today.\n We may yet meet again...Farewell, my friend!");
* Asks user to repeat message using standard commands if it does not comply with standard input format
System.out.println("The shadow of my memory is long...State what you would ask clearly.");
* Reads user message and prints an appropriate response back
ListObject l2 = new Event("Am writing test cases", 0);
ListObject l3 = new Event("Finish test cases", 1);
ListObject l2 = new ToDo("Am writing test cases", 0);
ListObject l3 = new ToDo("Finish test cases", 1);
